intro: Acidanthera zanzibarica, commonly known as the Zanzibar lily, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has strap-shaped leaves and produces inflorescences that consist of several small, clustered flowers. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
